alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Fisher; Jones; Nolan; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:37PM CDT until May 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CALLAHAN...JONES...NOLAN...SOUTHWESTERN SHACKELFORD...TAYLOR...SOUTHEASTERN FISHER AND NORTHWESTERN RUNNELS COUNTIES... At 936 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stith to Nolan, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Tye and Hylton around 945 PM CDT. Dyess Afb around 950 PM CDT. Happy Valley, Caps and Coronados Camp around 955 PM CDT. Wylie around 1000 PM CDT. Potosi around 1010 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Funston, Impact, The Intersection Of Us- 180 And Ranch Road 126, Lake Abilene, Camp Tonkawa, Hitson, Shep, Lake Fort Phantom Hill, Gannon and Lake Sweetwater. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 296. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Callahan; Fisher; Jones; Nolan; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor
